stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session building and testing a Super Mario Land-style, forward-scrolling shooter section for Course 14. He models a low-poly flying enemy (a bird/chicken), chooses attack sounds, debates camera and collision design, and fine-tunes visual details while discussing emulator compatibility and demo plans.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 is roughly “half way done,” with the shooter sub-section assets nearing completion (bird enemy, bullet shots, airplane variant, 3D clouds TBD).
development_findings.quote: After this I have two more stages, but course 14 is already like half way done.

development_findings.summary: Enemy death animation will be an 8-frame animated texture rather than multiple 3D models to save memory and triangle count (~19 000 tris so far).
development_findings.quote: What if we just have it be an animated texture… we’re actually not doing voxel art here, we just make this texture spawn.

development_findings.summary: Bird enemy redesigned: thicker head, new eyes, black outline, symmetric model, wings animated by rotating sub-mesh instead of frame-by-frame geometry.
development_findings.quote: Oh yeah, that’s a lot nicer… this outline on the birds makes them so much easier to see.

development_findings.summary: Selected Bullet Bill–style SFX for player shots after testing several samples; slowed fire rate for balance.
development_findings.quote: That’s nice… I think it shoots a bit too fast.

development_findings.summary: Camera kept fixed and centered for aiming clarity; off-center or following cameras rejected after Star Fox comparison.
development_findings.quote: How are you going to aim if I rotate the camera view?

development_findings.summary: Performance/memory budgeting: cannot afford multiple wing models; still debating 3D versus sprite clouds; level already heavy on triangles.
development_findings.quote: On one hand, that’s fair. On the other hand, that’s a lot of 3D model data I also need to store… this already has 19 000 triangles.

development_findings.summary: Lighting bug in course X2 remains unresolved; may disable lighting for demo if necessary.
development_findings.quote: Still need to fix that one lighting bug in X2… I can just remove lighting from the demo.

development_findings.summary: Microcode swaps (RSP vs RDP) considered to optimise specific areas, but mid-frame swaps deemed unwise.
development_findings.quote: You can change microcode mid-frame, but I think that’s not very wise.

development_findings.summary: Demo strategy: next public demo will include only the first course; shooter section not planned for that build.
development_findings.quote: I’m going to release a new demo… but it’s just going to be the first course.

development_findings.summary: Distribution planning: wants a turnkey package because every extra setup step (patching ROM, emulator settings) “loses percentage of player base.”
development_findings.quote: Every step along the way… you lose some percentage of your player base and the more unusual your setup is the higher the percentage.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is unusually low-energy; parents are visiting and prolonged social interaction exhausts him.
context_findings.quote: Even though that looked so easy just now, I don’t know why I’m so exhausted… my parents are here right now, I can’t be around people for too long.

context_findings.summary: He is wary of piracy (virus risk) yet reluctant to pay twice for Minecraft; reflects broader attitude toward spending on software.
context_findings.quote: I’m a little bit scared to pirate games actually… I really don’t want to get a virus on my computer.

context_findings.summary: Believes consistent thumbnail style important for YouTube algorithm; chooses ‘random Mario’ render as channel brand.
context_findings.quote: It’s important on YouTube that your thumbnails have a somewhat consistent style… I have decided that the style for my thumbnails will be the random Mario from back then.

context_findings.summary: Accepts possibility of Nintendo takedown but chooses to continue; last legal friction was in 2019.
context_findings.quote: Of course there is a worry that Nintendo is just going to say now fuck you… you just have to live with that.

biobak.summary: Arrives late in chat; no direct work shown this session.

zeina.summary: Briefly noted as cold and possibly interested in playing Minecraft; no project contribution today.
zeina.quote: Zena’s tall is a cold. Yeah, she’s very very cold

key_stories.title: The Off-Center Camera Mystery
key_stories.summary: Viewers noticed Mario was not centered in the shooter prototype. Kaze initially denies the issue, re-examines the setup, and discovers the offset, quickly fixing it.
key_stories.challenge: Player aiming felt off; chat claimed Mario wasn’t centered.
key_stories.process: Compared on-screen coordinates, realised model offset, adjusted transform.
key_stories.outcome: Camera now perfectly centered, improving aiming feel.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh wait, he is not centered. What the fuck, you’re right. I’m wrong.

key_stories.title: Bird Enemy Redesign
key_stories.summary: Kaze refines a low-poly bird based on chat-supplied pixel art. He enlarges the head, adds outlines, and swaps to animated textures for death to save memory.
key_stories.challenge: Original model looked skinny and required high poly count for wing animations.
key_stories.process: Consulted sprite reference, adjusted proportions, removed backside faces, opted for texture-based animation.
key_stories.outcome: Clearer silhouette, lower memory footprint, final asset approved.
key_stories.key_quote: Enemy death? We just switch between those 8 frames… it’s that simple.
